item.title: New details emerge about the relationship between an Alabama inmate and corrections officer as search continues
item.description: As the search continues for a fugitive inmate and the Alabama corrections officer who allegedly helped him escape, new details are emerging about the pair's relationship and the officer's apparent preparations for their getaway.
item.dc:creator: CNN
item.enclosure: Composite image shows Casey Cole White, left, and Assistant Director of Corrections Vicky White. (U.S. Marshals Service, Lauderdale County Sheriff's Office via AP)

item.title: Pope Francis warns pro-war Russian patriarch not to be 'Putin's altar boy'
item.description: Pope Francis warned the leader of the Russian Orthodox Church, Patriarch Kirill, not to become 'Putin's altar boy,' he said in an interview this week.
item.dc:creator: CNN
item.enclosure: Pope Francis, left, and Russian Orthodox Patriarch Kirill in Havana, Cuba, on Feb. 12, 2016. (Gregorio Borgia / AP)

item.title: 'Mariupol is the city of the dead.' One soldier's first hand account of life on the front lines
item.description: In an exclusive interview with CTVNews.ca, one member of the Azov Regiment currently inside the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol describes life under siege; 'it's living hell.'
item.dc:creator: Christy Somos
item.enclosure: In this screenshot taken from video, Lt. Ilya Samoilenko of the Azov Regiment speaks to CTVNews.ca from inside the Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, Ukraine. (CTV News)

item.title: DND says review exonerates Canada's mission in Ukraine of training extremists
item.description: The Department of National Defence says it has concluded its 2021 review into the findings of a report from George Washington University that alleged Canadian Armed Forces trained Ukrainian soldiers who belong to extremist groups and found itself absolved.
item.dc:creator: Christy Somos
item.enclosure: A photo posted in 2019 to Centuria’s Telegram shows a group of uniformed men posing next to one of the buildings of the Ukrainian National Army Academy. The building is part of the NAA’s campus in Lviv. It is possible that Centuria’s manipulation of the original photo included a modification that changed the banner in the resulting image to feature a Sonnenkreuz as opposed to a symbol reminiscent of crosshairs on a target, according to the report. (Oleksiy Kuzmenko/George Washington University IEREs/Military Order Centuria/Telegram)

item.title: 97 per cent of the Afghan population now facing food shortages: UN
item.description: According to the United Nations, 97 per cent of Afghans are experiencing food shortages -- and many had their first solid meals on Eid when charities and NGO's offered food programs for when they broke their fasts.
item.dc:creator: Rhythm Sachdeva
item.enclosure: A family prepares tea outside the Directorate of Disaster office where they are camped, in Herat, Afghanistan, on Nov. 29, 2021. (AP Photo/Petros Giannakouris, File)

item.title: Tens of thousands rally to demand Armenian PM's resignation
item.description: Tens of thousands of protesters blocked streets and gathered around government buildings in Armenia's capital on Wednesday to demand the prime minister's resignation over his calls for a formal peace agreement with neighboring Azerbaijan.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Armenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan in Moscow, Russia, on April 20, 2022. (Dmitry Astakhov, Sputnik, Government Pool Photo via AP)

item.title: Donald Trump Jr. speaks with Jan. 6 committee: AP sources
item.description: The oldest son of former President Donald Trump has met with the congressional committee investigating the Jan. 6, 2021, insurrection at the U.S. Capitol, according to two people familiar with the matter.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Donald Trump Jr., speaks at the Conservative Political Action Conference (CPAC) on Feb. 27, 2022, in Orlando, Fla. (AP Photo/John Raoux, File)

item.title: U.S. election 2022: JD Vance wins Ohio's GOP Senate primary
item.description: 'Hillbilly Elegy' author JD Vance won Ohio's contentious and hyper-competitive GOP Senate primary on Tuesday, buoyed by Donald Trump's endorsement in a race that was an early test of the former president's hold on his party as the midterm season kicks into high gear.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: JD Vance and former U.S. President Donald Trump at a rally at the Delaware County Fairground, on April 23, 2022. (Joe Maiorana / AP)

item.title: Judge overseeing Chauvin civil rights case accepts plea deal
item.description: The judge overseeing the federal civil rights cases of four former Minneapolis police officers in the killing of George Floyd said Wednesday that he has accepted the terms of Derek Chauvin's plea agreement and will sentence him to 20 to 25 years in prison.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
item.enclosure: Derek Chauvin addresses the court in June 25, 2021, at the Hennepin County Courthouse in Minneapolis. (Court TV via AP, Pool, File)

item.title: DHS watchdog says Trump's agency appears to have altered report on Russian interference in 2020 election in part because of politics
item.description: Former U.S. President Donald Trump's Department of Homeland Security delayed and altered an intelligence report related to Russian interference in the 2020 election, making changes that 'appear to be based in part on political considerations,' according to a newly released watchdog report.
item.dc:creator: CNN
item.enclosure: In this Sept. 23, 2020, file photo, Department of Homeland Security acting Secretary Chad Wolf makes an opening statement at his confirmation hearing before the Senate Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs Committee on Capitol Hill in Washington. (Greg Nash/AP via CNN)
